nodes.bodyText: Please add detailed Javadoc for these functions, as they will be the point of entry for users - they also will help me understand what's a snow pipe : )
Sure, thanks for noticing. I hope it will help :)
Please add javadoc
Sure, thanks for noticing
Javadoc please
Sure, I will add to all missing methods.
Please improve the error message specifying that withSnowPipe is required for streaming / unbounded PCollections
Sure, I will change it.
Please make the error message more informative
Sure, I will change it.
A PCollection after a combine / GBK / etc - keeps the trigger configuration from upstream. Did you find that you needed to restate the trigger like this?
I am not sure if I know what should be correct approach and what are the consequences of current one. Can you elaborate on that? @pabloem
I think we can leave this as it is. I see that the trigger is not the exact same.
We are concatenating this in memory. Is this intended? I guess you would end up with a number of files equal to the number shards, which shouldn't be too large?

I haven't met any limitations yet but I agree - logically too large list of files might be a problem. But I am not sure how differently solve this. The only thing that comes to my mind if Reify but I am not sure if it's correct path. WDYT @pabloem ?
You can just KeyBy(same key) + GroupByKey, and read one by one - but it may be fine to leave as is if we don't expect > 100 files or so
TODO(pabloem) Review this section
Add Javadoc to this class? (including whether it's considered part of the public API)

nodes.bodyText: I am a little confused about these lines (53-62). What does this do?

Maybe it should be somehow moved to another method and named properly.
The main idea is that the output PCollection from TextIO.write has the method which lets extract names of saved files: .getPerDestinationOutputFilenames(). Unfortunately Snowflake's ingestFiles accepts only Set of files' names to be loaded, but without full path and quotation mark which the .getPerDestinationOutputFilenames() returns.
That's why we need remove from filelist name of the bucket directory where they lie and also '.
I just saw that I can make it shorter:
 Set<String> files =
        filesList.stream()
            .map(e -> e.replaceAll(String.valueOf(stagingBucketDir), ""))
            .map(e -> e.replaceAll("'", ""))
            .collect(Collectors.toSet());

😊
cool: )
TODO(pabloem) Review these tests
Can you add javadoc for this class? It'll help understand its role, and it'll help users figure out if they're meant to use this class or not.

nodes.bodyText:
I know this was discussed earlier, but I am somewhat concerned about using CSV as the method to write. Is this not risky? Have you verified that it works well for all types (Numeric, Date/Time, Decimal, Strings with newlines, etc.)?
I recommend you add an integration test that tests all - or most - data types once we have the Snowflake instance to test.

Yes, I agree that CSV can be a little bit problematic here. On the other hand apparently it is the most efficient way of loading data to Snowflake.
We have some tests that were checking different ways of data quotation and problematic characters. But I agree it should be included in integration tests as well. Would it be ok with you if I create Jira ticket for extending integration tests?
that makes sense to me. Thanks Kasia!
should these attributes also be final?
You are right thanks :)
